  • Constructor Details

    • SNIDApp

      public SNIDApp​(java.lang.String filename, char delimiter)
      A Constructor for the SNIDApp class. Takes in a file and a character separator. Reads the Information from the file and creates an arrayList to store Citizen's Information. Instanstiate a SNIDDb object using the same file and character separator.
      Parameters:
      filename - Stores the name of the file as a string.
      delimiter - Stores the chracter separator to split each line in the file.

  • Method Details

    • getCitizen

      A method to return a Citizen given their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - String representation of a Citizen's Unique Identification.
      Returns:
      A Citizen object with the given ID.

    • addElement

      Parameters:

      element - The element to be added to the array.
      Returns:
      An array with the element added to the array.

    • registerBirth

      public void registerBirth​(char gender, int yob, java.lang.String fName, java.lang.String mName, java.lang.String lName)
      A method to add a citizen to the arrayList created in the Constructor. It checks if the IdFile exists(That is the file that stores the ID of the last Citizen registered). If the file exists it reads the value from this file, increment it by one and set the new value as the new Citizen ID whilst storing this value back to the file. If it doesn't exists, it creates the file, placing the static ID in the file, that is to be read from and incremented when another citizen is to be registered. Sets the Citizen's lifestatus to "Alive". Files are created and/or open with try-resources so the scanner and writer are automatically closed.
      Parameters:
      gender - The gender of the citizen, represented as a character 'M'/'F'.
      yob - The year in which the Citizen was born.
      fName - The first name of the Citizen.
      mName - The middle name of the Citizen.
      lName - The last name of the Citizen.

    • getCurrentCitizenID

      public java.lang.String getCurrentCitizenID()
      A method to get the ID of the Citizen currently being registered.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the Citizen's Unique Identification.

    • addParentData

      public void addParentData​(java.lang.String childID, java.lang.String fatherID, java.lang.String motherID)
      A method to link a child to his/her Parents. The method checks if each of the ID given are valid. If the IDs given are all valid, the method "setParent" is called, by which the Parent's Information is added to child.
      Parameters:
      childID - The string representation of the child's ID.
      fatherID - The string representation of the father's ID.
      motherID - The string representation of the mother's ID.

    • checkIDS

      public int checkIDS​(java.lang.String ID)
      A method to check if the ID given exists. returns 1 for true, 0 for false.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID to be verified.
      Returns:
      An Integer signifying validity.

    • updateAddress

      public void updateAddress​(java.lang.String citizenID, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String town, java.lang.String parish, java.lang.String country)
      A method to change where a citizen lives.
      Parameters:
      citizenID - The ID of the citizen's address to be changed.
      street - The citizen's new street.
      town - The citizen's new town.
      parish - The citizen's new parish.
      country - The citizen's new country.

    • registerDeath

      public void registerDeath​(java.lang.String citizenID, java.lang.String cause, java.lang.String place, java.lang.String date)
      A method to a register a citizen as deceased. It instantiate a DeathCert object. It checks if the deathRefNoFile exists(That is the file that stores the Death Certificate ID of the last Citizen registered). If the file exists it reads the value from this file, increment it by one and set the new value as the new Death Certificate ID whilst storing this value back to the file. If it doesn't exists, it creates the file, placing the static ID in the file, that is to be read from and incremented when another citizen is to be registered. Sets the Citizen's lifestatus to "Deceased". Creates a file for each citizen that stores their death certificate inside of the folder Registered Deceased. Files are created and/or open with try-resources so the scanner and writer are automatically closed.
      Parameters:
      citizenID - A String representation of the citizen's ID.
      cause - The reason for the citizen's death.
      place - The place the citizen died.
      date - The date the citizeb died.

    • checkCitizenDeathInfo

      public boolean checkCitizenDeathInfo​(java.lang.String ID)
      A method to check whether a citizen has been registered as deceased. It checks for the citizen death certificate file, which is the name of their ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - The string representation of the Citizen ID.
      Returns:
      A boolean that signifies the existence of a citizen death certificate.

    • registerMarriage

      public void registerMarriage​(java.lang.String groomID, java.lang.String brideID, java.lang.String date)
      A method to a register two citizens as marrried. It checks if each of the given ids are valid. It instantiate a MarrriageCert object. It checks if the marriageRefNoFile exists(That is the file that stores the Marriage Certificate ID of the last Citizen registered). If the file exists it reads the value from this file, increment it by one and set the new value as the new Marriage Certificate ID whilst storing this value back to the file. If it doesn't exists, it creates the file, placing the static ID in the file, that is to be read from and incremented when two other citizens are to be married. It changes the bride's last name to the groom's last name. It creates a marriage certificate files that stores the marriage certificates of all citizens. Files are created and/or open with try-resources so the scanner and writer are automatically closed.
      Parameters:
      groomID - The String representation of the Groom ID.
      brideID - The String representation of the Bride ID.
      date - The Date in which the two citizens married.

    • mailingLabel

      A method to return a Citizen's Mailing Label.
      Parameters:
      citizenID - The string representation of the Citizen ID.
      Returns:

    • search

      public java.lang.String search​(java.lang.String citizenID)
      A method to locate a citizen, given their ID. An empty string is returned if citizen is not found.
      Parameters:
      citizenID - The string representation of the citizen ID.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the citizen's information - ID, Gender, First Name, Middle Name, Last Name.

    • getRecords

      public java.util.List<Citizen> getRecords()
      A method to get the ArrayList of Citizens.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList with the information of each citizen.

    • search

      public java.lang.String[] search​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName)
      A method to locate a citizen, given their first and last name. null is returned if citizen is not found.
      Parameters:
      firstName - The Citizen's First Name.
      lastName - The Citizen's Last Name.
      Returns:
      A string array of the citizen's information - ID, Gender, First Name, Middle Name, Last Name.

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      A method to close the file from which the citizen's information was in and open it for writing. The updated information of each citizen is written back to the file.
